alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Cheshire; Coastal Rockingham; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Merrimack; Northern Carroll; Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton; Strafford; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 15 at 11:20AM EDT until July 15 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .Multiple rounds of torrential showers are anticipated Sunday through Sunday night. There is increasing confidence that locally considerable impacts are possible for areas with repeating activity. Highest threat areas are those that have been recently affected by heavy rain as well as highly sloped, fast-responding small streams in the mountains. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Numerous Flash floods caused by torrential downpours, some locally considerable impacts are possible. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following areas, Interior Cumberland Highlands, Interior York, Northern Franklin, Northern Oxford, Southern Franklin and Southern Oxford. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following areas, Belknap, Cheshire, Coastal Rockingham, Eastern Hillsborough, Interior Rockingham, Merrimack, Northern Carroll, Northern Coos, Northern Grafton, Southern Carroll, Southern Coos, Southern Grafton, Strafford, Sullivan and Western And Central Hillsborough. * WHEN...From Sunday morning through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Flash flooding can involve major disruptions to travel, damages to property, and displacement of people. The risk is high for campers near fast responding streams which could become dangerous rivers with flood waters spreading well away from the banks. Inundation of roads are likely with additional washouts and some long term closures possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Multiple rounds of torrential rainfall are expected. Saturated soils from recent rainfall will support rapid runoff and lead to flash flooding. Considerable impacts are possible where storms repeat.
info.instruction: If you are in a flood prone area, prepare for rapid onset flooding, with minimum time to react. Never camp on low ground next to streams since a flash flood can catch you while you`re asleep.
